question: During photosynthesis
choices: light reactions produce sugar, while the Calvin cycle produces O2.
light reactions produce NADPH and ATP, while the Calvin cycle produces sugar.
light reactions photophosphorylate ADP, while the Calvin cycle produces ATP.
the Calvin cycle produces both sugar and O2.

question: Which of the following statements best explains the increase in beak size?
choices: Finches with bigger and stronger beaks were able to attack and kill the finches with smaller beaks.
Finches with bigger beaks were larger animals with stronger wings that could fly to other islands and gather a wide variety of seeds.
During the drought, the finches' beaks grew larger to accommodate the need to eat tougher seeds.
Finches with larger beaks were able to eat the tougher seeds and were healthier and reproduced more offspring that inherited the trait for wider beaks.

question: Which of the following statements best explains the mechanism behind the change in beak size?
choices: A new allele appeared in the finch population as a result of a mutation.
A change in the frequency of a gene was due to selective pressure from the environment.
A new trait appeared in the population because of recombination of alleles.
A new trait appeared in the population because of genetic drift.

question: Which of the following best states the pattern of inheritance shown in the pedigree?
choices: The trait is sex-linked dominant.
The trait is sex-linked recessive.
The trait is autosomal dominant.
The trait is autosomal recessive.

question: Which of the following statement is supported by the information given in the pedigree?
choices: The P generation mother is X-X.
The P generation father is X-Y.
If parents 1 and 2 in row II have another child, the chance that the child would be afflicted with alkaptonuria is 25%.
The genotype of woman 1 is X-X.

question: Plates that have only ampicillin-resistant bacteria growing on them include which of the following?
choices: Plate 1 only
Plate 2 only
Plate 3 only
Plates 1 and 3 only

question: Which of the following statements explains why there was no growth on Plate 3?
choices: The heat shock technique to make the E.coli competent killed the bacteria.
Those particular E.coli bacteria were inhibited from growing by the nutrient in the agar.
Those bacteria were not transformed.
The bacteria culture died because they have a short life span.

question: Which of the following statements best explains why there were fewer colonies on Plate 1 than on Plate 2?
choices: The bacteria on Plate 2 did not transform.
There was no antibiotic in the agar in Plate 2 that would have restricted growth of bacteria.
The transformation of bacteria on Plate 2 was more successful.
The bacteria on Plates 1 and 2 were not taken from the same culture.

question: In a variant of this experiment, the plasmid contained GFP (green fluorescent protein) in addition to ampicillin resistance. Which of the following plates would have the highest percentage of bacteria that would fluoresce?
choices: Plate 1 only
Plate 2 only
Plate 3 only
Plate 4 only

question: Which of the following predicts what will happen in the continued presence of the antibodies?
choices: Ca⁺⁺ ions will flood into the motor neuron ending, increasing the release of more ACh.
The amount of neurotransmitter being released will decrease.
The number of action potentials in the motor neuron will decrease.
Antibodies will destroy the postsynaptic receptors, and the muscle response will diminish.
